data.title: Prabhat Jain
data.text:
Work Experience

Founder – Monsoon Multimedia

October 2011 – Present

Leading provider of products and technologies to stream hi quality standards based video across various devices, internet and the cloud. Customers include over 250,000 consumers in 75 countries and significant global corporations.

CEO – Emuzed

2000 – 2004

Leading provider of software engines that compressed and decompressed audio and video for mobile phones. Customers included Nokia, Samsung, Motorola and TI. Additionally, Emuzed was the first company to develop Media Center hardware for Microsoft. These PCI cards were used by companies such as HP, Compaq, Dell and Toshiba.

CEO – Dazzle Multimedia

1996 – 1999

Pioneered the development and shipment of over 1 million MPEG1 and 2 cards for the PC. Dazzle used semiconductors from C-Cube Microsystems and developed comprehensive software engines and user interfaces for consumers to compress, store and burn CDs and DVDs from their PCs.

CEO – Value Media/Turtle Beach

1993 – 1997

Developed mass volume integrated audio cards with CD Rom drives and shipped to retailers worldwide. Turtle Beach acquired Value Media and used the retail markets for its own branded products.

CEO – Video-7

1985 – 1990

In conjunction with Steve Jobs and Walt Broedner, developed the first RGB color card for the Apple computers. Later worked with Gordy Campbell’s Chips n Technologies to architect the first VGA card for the IBM PC. Developed the world’s first single chip VGA, the technology was licensed to Cirrus Logic and LSI Logic.

Co-Founder and Director – HES, Paradise Systems

1981 – 1985

Established a 50 employee team recruited from UC Berkeley College of Engineering to convert top video games from the Atari console to the Commodore VIC-64. Microsoft licensed its Multiplan accounting package to HES (Human Engineered Software). Customers were leading retailers and distributors. Recruited two scientists (Alex Lushtak and Henry Laxen) to form Paradise System. Paradise engineers developed the world’s first color card in 1982 and later a powerful single chip VGA.

CEO – USI

1976 – 1982

USI was a supply chain specialist with manufacturing plants in the Bay Area and Taiwan. USI supplied modules to Atari, Mattel, Commodore, TI, NS and others in the Video Game Console market. It shipped over 2 million units of joy sticks, power adapters, cable assemblies and finished game consoles. USI helped companies such as Foxconn and others gain insight and foothold in the USA markets.

Co-Founder and Director – Solectron

1977 – 1981

Together with Roy Kusomoto, Director of Operations at Atari, established the first sub-assembly plant in Silicon Valley in 1977. Winston Chen would acquire the majority shares in Solectron and build a very successful company.
